meanings.definition: A boneless cut or slice of meat or fish.
meanings.sent1: I ordered a juicy filet for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef grilled the filet to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The filet was so tender, it practically melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her filet of salmon was a work of culinary art.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the sizzling filet made my mouth water.

meanings.sent1: She learned how to filet a fish in cooking class.
meanings.sent2: He carefully fileted the chicken breast for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally fileted the bread instead of slicing it.
meanings.sent4: The skilled sushi chef can filet a tuna with precision.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman showed me how to filet a trout with ease.

meanings.definition: A narrow strip of ribbon or similar material.
meanings.sent1: She tied a filet of ribbon around the gift box.
meanings.sent2: The filet of lace added a delicate touch to the dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the filet of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The filet of fabric was perfect for the craft project.
meanings.sent5: The filet of paper fluttered in the breeze.
